sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now, I'm Mariam Zaidi and these are the headlines this hour.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: President Putin and Xi Jinping stand together as they meet in Beijing to reaffirm their support in the face of what they call US interference in the internal affairs of other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: EU Commission Chief Ursula von der Leyen says diplomacy to ease tensions between Ukraine and Russia must continue, but says Brussels is ready with sanctions if Moscow moves on Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The pressure builds on Boris Johnson's premiership as a fifth aide quits and another conservative MP calls on the Prime Minister to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And the 2022 Winter Olympics is officially underway with a stunning display of fireworks and fanfare at the opening ceremony in Beijing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Welcome to the programme. The leaders of Russia and China have issued a joint statement opposing NATO expansion and affirming that the island of Taiwan is part of China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: opposing NATO expansion and affirming that the island of Taiwan is part of China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meeting in Beijing ahead of the Olympic opening ceremony, Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping said they strongly support each other in the face of what they called U.S. interference in the internal affairs of other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They also called on NATO to abandon the ideologized approaches of the Cold War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: or NATO to abandon the ideologized approaches of the Cold War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Moscow has categorically rejected U.S. claims that Russia is planning a false flag operation to justify an attack on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Pentagon on Thursday accused Moscow of preparing what it called a very graphic propaganda video depicting a fake attack by Ukrainian forces on Russian people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But speaking to reporters in Beijing this afternoon, Russia's Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov dismissed the claim as nonsense.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: While I'm here in Beijing, I read some statements by the US State Department that Russia is preparing fake videos showing an alleged attack by Ukrainian troops in Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: video showing an alleged attack by Ukrainian troops in Donbas. Well, I do not know the delusional nature of this kind of fabrication, and there are more and more of them every day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's obvious to any more or less experienced political scientist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Our Russia analyst Galina Polanskaya says pressure from the West is pushing China and Russia together.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: First of all, the Chinese leader supported Russia's concerns, security concerns, and they both urged NATO to stop its expansion in this final joint statement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This is very important, but it is not only about this political message about those, let's say, big powers as Russia and China standing against the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It is also about business here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Today, Vladimir Putin announced that Russia and China are going to have another gas contract and that Russia will sell even more gas to China via a new pipeline and that the sales will be in Euro so it means that they want to reduce any risks if there are some sanctions here Russia has been already sent selling gas to China so it will be selling even more and we should not forget the chain is the biggest trading partner of Russia and And in 2014, when Crimea was annexed, it was China that supported Russia economically and politically when it found itself in the isolation from the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So the big message today is that if there are any other sanctions, China will provide this support to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And I think that this is a message also to the Russian businessmen who worry at this point, of course.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So lots of deals and maneuvers between the two leaders then.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: You also brought up sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now, we do know that the EU is preparing this very comprehensive package of sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The EU Commission president has said that in Brussels today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But European diplomacy is also continuing. Now, President Macron will, of course, travel to Moscow next week. What more can you tell us about that?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Yes. On Monday, Vladimir Putin will welcome President of France Emmanuel Macron in Moscow and it was actually Vladimir Putin who gave sent those let's say positive signals because it was him who announced this visit even when nobody could even think that this could happen so this is very surprising that the question what are the odds that there are any chances of some positive outcome?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Of course, President Macron will try to persuade Vladimir Putin to get back the Normandy format on the rails and to put it on the higher level, on the foreign minister's level.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But, of course, he will try to persuade to organize a summit between the leaders to put back Russia andraine at the table of negotiations and of course we know what vladimir putin could answer because russia says that it's not the uh this side of the conflict it wants uh kiev to talk with the danbas representatives it wants uh kiev to fulfill the minsk, and that's what Vladimir Putin could ask Emmanuel Macron is to push Kyiv as it can.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And what is also very surprising is that Emmanuel Macron is going first to Moscow and after to Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And of course, in Europe, people, those who will be watching the allies, want that this visit is transparent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now since the start of the current tensions, the EU has promised to impose sanctions on Russia if it launched an attack. But the details have been slow in coming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now Brussels says it has a comprehensive package ready to go, as Commission President Ursula von der Leyen told EFI Kutukosta. και έχει ένα συγκεντρωμένο πακέτο, έτοιμο να πάει. Όπως είπε η Ευρωβουλευτική Επιτροπή, η Πρόεδρε Ορσούλα Φοντε Λάιον, Εφί Κουτουκώστα.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Μέσα από την διπλόμασή και τις αξίες, η Ευρώπη προσπαθεί να προσπαθεί σε μια ιδιαίτερη ρασιακή εμφανισμό στην Ουκρανία.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Η Ευρωβουλευτική Επιτροπή μιλήθηκε με την Πρόεδρο Πρόεδρο, την Ευρωβουλευτή Ωρσούλα Φοντε Λάιον, όπως οι ταινίες σημαίνουν στις εξωτερικές πλευρές της Ευρώπης.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Δεν βλέπουμε κανένα σημασία της αξιόδοξης. Στο αντίθετο, βλέπουμε ότι η Ρωσία και ο ΙΠΑ blocks eastern borders. We see no sign of de-escalation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the contrary, we see that both Russia and now the United States are amassing more troops on both sides.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So you see that diplomacy has failed and now Europe is spiraling towards a real war?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We should never give up to work on diplomacy because as Russia has created this crisis, we do everything for diplomacy and dialogue to be successful. But we are very clear also that in case that there's any further military aggression of Russia against Ukraine, that this will have severe consequences and massive costs for Russia. And we have prepared a robust and very comprehensive package of sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Can you tell us more about this package of sanctions?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It would limit the access of Russia to the financial markets of the European Union, and it would limit Russia's access to crucial goods and technology it needs, and that cannot be easily supplied and replaced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And therefore it must be in the interest of Russia to de-escalate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But can Europe really afford to impose sanctions that could put its energy supplies at risk?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Indeed, this would be a severe situation, but we have done our homework and we are working intensively of preventing and being prepared for such a situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I've created a partnership for energy security with President Biden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Next week there will be a summit on this energy security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And of course we have spoken to many different LNG suppliers worldwide who are very interested in going into the gap that Russia would leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Finally, I would like to ask you about the EU as a bloc, because we see individual member states taking their own initiatives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: For example, the Hungarian prime minister visited Moscow and President Putin and publicly described Russian demands as reasonable and sanctions as pointless.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So what is the leverage that the EU as a bloc has in this stage, in this global crisis?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There is unity and very strong alignment within the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And what Hungary is concerned so far they always supported the sanctions against Russia and they have so far announced that of course they will keep the unity with the European Union if it is necessary to act okay president thank you very much for this interview thank you diplomatic efforts to prevent the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: conflict are ongoing but in Ukraine a group of foreign fighters is preparing for the worst.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: International correspondent Annelies Bokhsherz reports from Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Since Russia started positioning its troops near the border with Ukraine, it's not just military equipment arriving from the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I've been following this conflict since 2014, where the Russian Federation has illegally annexed Crimea. And since then, I've watched them progressively interfere in other countries to stick their fingers where they don't belong. And it's just been building since then.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And I saw it was about to start again. I figured I'd come here and help the people of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: While U.S. President Joe Biden announced the deployment of nearly 3,000 troops to Eastern Europe, Justin D is not here in an official capacity. He voluntarily traveled thousands of kilometers from his home in New York to join a fight he says may have worldwide implications. Today, Ukraine is the front line of the fight for democracy, the fight for Western ideology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I think if Russia succeeds in subduing Ukraine, they're not going to stop.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They're going to keep going until they control all of Europe, until they subvert and manipulate every global leader and turn it into their puppet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And I'm here to stop that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: that. Justin D joined the Georgian National Legion, a unit of foreign fighters present in Ukraine since 2014, which has started attracting new candidates since the renewed rise in tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: JUSTIN D, A week ago, we started a new process of recruitment of foreigners. There are a lot of people applying. Mostly, the leader is Georgia, again. We have more than 300 applicants only from Georgia. The second is United States, United Kingdom, Australia, Italy, Germany. So, these are the basic countries now who are trying to volunteer in Georgia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian Minister of Defense does not comment on the number of foreigners currently enlisted in the country's armed forces. Off the record, soldiers say that is a trend, but they would like to see Western boots on the ground officially. And while that isn't a reality, many here say they are happy that some are taking the step.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And Justin expects others will follow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I hope my presence here does send a message that the world is not going to stand by idly, that citizens, even if their governments won't stand for what's right, the citizens of each individual country will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Annelies Borges in Kiev for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Montenegro's government faces collapse after the National Assembly decided against Prime Minister Krivo Kapic's call for an early election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Friday's landmark decision comes as the dysfunctional coalition failed to make any progress in passing reforms after over a year in power. The Parliament is also debating a motion of no confidence in the leader who came to power in August 2020. Now if a vote of no confidence is passed the Deputy Prime Minister Abbasavish is expected to form a minority government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Rotterdam's iconic De Heff Bridge is at the centre of a dispute between the city's residents and Amazon founder Jeff Bezos. The multi-billionaire wants to temporarily dismantle the 95-year-old monument to allow his new luxury superyacht to sail out to sea. However, the council had promised not to touch the iconic bridge after it was restored in 2017. Officials say they have yet to make a decision.
